author: Brattleboro Reformer
title: Lynde answers football questions
text:
1 » 
BRATTLEBORO >> Griffin Lynde is a junior at Brattleboro Union High School and is the varsity football player spotlight of the week. Griffin is a wide receiver and cornerback for the Colonels. 
Question: What is the most important lesson you have learned from playing on the BUHS football team? 
Griffin's answer: Teamwork! Football is not an individual sport; it is the ultimate team sport. Everyone has a job to do that forms a system that works perfectly. Trust your teammates to do their assignment and trust yourself to do yours and if that goes well you will have a perfect play every time. 
Question: What is the best part of being on the BUHS football team? 
Griffin's answer: I feel like out of any program at the high school this one has the most commitment to the team. I have never played a sport that feels like being on the BUHS football team before; it is a feeling of friendship and connection — like being part of a family. We have pasta parties every week during the season and work out together off-season. We are like a family — we all feel the same about each other whether we have just come off an incredible win or a terrible loss. 
Question: How do you encourage a teammate to be the best they can be on and off the field? 
Griffin's answer: You have to encourage someone positively to be their best. Everyone is a brother on the team and you don't want to shut anyone down, everyone is important. I accept their mistakes and encourage them to move on and keep trying. Advertisement 
Question: What is the most important piece of advice you have gotten from your coach? 
Griffin's answer: Always focus on what is important now, like the 1st play or the 1st quarter, and keep moving forward to make the present better.
